intro: Erythroxylum novogranatense var. novogranatense, commonly known as the red coca plant, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in open, sunny areas with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it distinct from other species in the Erythroxylum genus.
